Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Wednesday December 11), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for wednesday, december 11th. 

google is expanding its ai operations with the acquisition of a toronto-based startup specializing in natural language processing. the move comes as competition in the ai space intensifies, with major players like microsoft and amazon also ramping up their investments in artificial intelligence. google says the acquisition will bolster its efforts in developing ai that better understands and generates human-like text.

meanwhile, facebook has announced new privacy features designed to give users more control over their data sharing. in a recent blog post, the company detailed enhancements to its privacy checkup tool, which now allows users to review and adjust settings related to their data interactions on the platform. the update is part of facebook’s broader initiative to address mounting concerns over data privacy and transparency.

in streaming news, netflix shares are rallying today following the company's announcement of a significant content deal with a major hollywood studio. the deal, reportedly worth billions, secures exclusive streaming rights to a slate of films and series over the next several years. analysts say this move could help netflix maintain its competitive edge against rivals like disney+ and hbo max.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for wednesday, december 11th.

google is making headlines in the ai space with its latest move—acquiring a toronto-based startup specializing in natural language processing. this strategic acquisition is part of google's broader push to enhance its capabilities in understanding and generating human-like text. the competition in ai is heating up, with major players like microsoft and amazon also increasing their investments in artificial intelligence.

over at facebook, new privacy features are being rolled out to give users greater control over their data. in a recent blog post, facebook revealed enhancements to its privacy checkup tool. this upgrade allows users to review and adjust their data sharing settings on the platform, reflecting facebook's ongoing commitment to addressing data privacy and transparency concerns.

in streaming news, netflix is enjoying a rally in its shares following a significant content deal announcement with a major hollywood studio. the deal, reportedly worth billions, grants netflix exclusive streaming rights to a slate of films and series over the next several years. analysts believe this move will help netflix maintain its competitive edge against streaming rivals like disney+ and hbo max.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-170 Google's Ai Acquisition 🧠, Facebook's Privacy Push 🔒, Netflix's Big Deal 🎥
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for wednesday, december 11th! explore today's top tech stories:

  • google’s latest acquisition: google acquires a toronto-based startup specializing in natural language processing as part of its strategy to enhance ai capabilities in text generation and understanding.
  • facebook's new privacy features: facebook introduces enhancements to its privacy checkup tool, allowing users to have more control over their data sharing settings.
  • netflix's major content deal: a significant agreement with a hollywood studio grants netflix exclusive streaming rights to a variety of films and series, boosting its competitive advantage over disney+ and hbo max.

stay tuned for tomorrow's tech updates!
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image featuring a futuristic cityscape at dusk, where sleek skyscrapers glow with holographic displays representing google's ai acquisition. in the center, a towering digital brain with circuit-like patterns illuminates the skyline, symbolizing advanced ai integration. to the left, a cluster of buildings is enveloped in a shimmering, translucent shield, illustrating facebook's privacy focus through a visual metaphor of protection. on the right, a large, vibrant cinema screen is projected against the night sky, showcasing vivid film scenes to represent netflix's major entertainment deal. the elements are interconnected with subtle digital light trails, creating a harmonious blend of technology, privacy, and entertainment themes in a single, imaginative landscape
